interface.name: rpm_manage_pid_files
interface.summary: Create, read, write, and delete rpm pid files.

interface.name: rpm_pid_filetrans

interface.name: rpm_transition_script
interface.summary: Allow application to transition to rpm_script domain.

interface.name: rpm_signull
interface.summary: Send a null signal to rpm.

interface.name: rpm_inherited_fifo
interface.summary: Send a null signal to rpm.

module.name: shorewall
module.summary: Shoreline Firewall high-level tool for configuring netfilter

interface.name: shorewall_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute a domain transition to run shorewall.

interface.name: shorewall_domtrans_lib
interface.summary: Execute a domain transition to run shorewall.

interface.name: shorewall_read_config
interface.summary: Read shorewall etc configuration files.

interface.name: shorewall_read_lib_files
interface.summary: Read shorewall /var/lib files.

interface.name: shorewall_rw_lib_files
interface.summary: Read and write shorewall /var/lib files.

interface.name: shorewall_read_tmp_files
interface.summary: Read shorewall tmp files.

interface.name: shorewall_admin
interface.summary: All of the rules required to administrate an shorewall environment

param.name: role
param.summary: The role to be allowed to manage the syslog domain.

interface.name: shutdown_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute a domain transition to run shutdown.

interface.name: shutdown_run
interface.summary: Execute shutdown in the shutdown domain, and allow the specified role the shutdown domain.

param.name: role
param.summary: The role to be allowed the shutdown domain.

interface.name: shutdown_role
interface.summary: Role access for shutdown

interface.name: shutdown_send_sigchld
interface.summary: Recieve sigchld from shutdown

interface.name: shutdown_dbus_chat
interface.summary: Send and receive messages from shutdown over dbus.

interface.name: shutdown_getattr_exec_files
interface.summary: Get attributes of shutdown executable.

module.name: su
module.summary: Run shells with substitute user and group

desc.p: This template creates a derived domain which is allowed to change the linux user id, to run shells as a different user.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

param.name: user_domain
param.summary: The type of the user domain.

param.name: user_role
param.summary: The role associated with the user domain.

template.name: su_role_template
template.summary: The role template for the su module.

param.name: role_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user role (e.g., user is the prefix for user_r).

param.name: user_role
param.summary: The role associated with the user domain.

param.name: user_domain
param.summary: The type of the user domain.

interface.name: su_exec
interface.summary: Execute su in the caller domain.

module.name: sudo
module.summary: Execute a command with a substitute user

template.name: sudo_role_template
template.summary: The role template for the sudo module.

desc.p: This template creates a derived domain which is allowed to change the linux user id, to run commands as a different user.

param.name: role_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user role (e.g., user is the prefix for user_r).

param.name: user_domain
param.summary: The user domain associated with the role.

interface.name: sudo_sigchld
interface.summary: Send a SIGCHLD signal to the sudo domain.

interface.name: sudo_exec
interface.summary: Allow execute sudo in called domain. This interfaces is added for nova-stack policy.

interface.name: sxid_read_log
interface.summary: Allow the specified domain to read sxid log files.

module.name: tmpreaper
module.summary: Manage temporary directory sizes and file ages

interface.name: tmpreaper_exec
interface.summary: Execute tmpreaper in the caller domain.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The type of the process performing this action.

desc.p: NOTE: Tripwire creates temp file in its current working directory. This policy does not allow write access to home directories, so users will need to either cd to a directory where they have write permission, or set the TEMPDIRECTORY variable in the tripwire config file. The latter is preferable, as then the file_type_auto_trans rules will kick in and label the files as private to tripwire.
